$$._: In mobile wireless sensor networks, Distributed Hash Tables (DHTs) based multipath routing protocols performs good in terms of energy consumption, delay, throughput etc. This paper strives to analyze and compare the experimental evaluation of M-DART, proactive multipath protocol, and AOMDV, reactive multipath protocol using Network Simulator. Different simulation experiments were performed to check the behavior of both of these multipath routing protocols for Mobile WSN scenario and we observed that MDART outperforms AOMDV in terms of energy consumption, end to end delay, throughput and packet loss percentage.
